result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey W Pearson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: All other probation now serving.

miscConds.notes: Complete an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations. Complete psychological evaluation and follow all treatment recommendations.   Maintain absolute sobriety.  Submit DNA sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: 8:46am/8:58am. Defendant Jeffrey W Pearson in court, in custody with attorney Amanda K. Riek. Atty Jane Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases heard 15CM596 & 16CM451.  Victim rights complied with. Defendant pleads no contest  to count 1 in 15CM596 & Count 3 in 16CM451.  Court will adjudge guilty and enter JOC.  All other charges dismissed and read in.  Court imposes on count 1 in 15CM596 & count 3 in 16CM461: sentence withheld and placed on probation for 2 years concurrent to any sentence now serving. Costs of $443.00, submit a DNA sample, AODA, psychological evaluation & absolute sobriety.  2 days jail credit in 15CM596 & 0 days credit in 16CM451.

9:03 A.M., Defendant Jeffrey W Pearson in court, in custody by video from Dodge Correctional Institution with attorney Amanda K. Riek present.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Riek withdrawing requesting to change plea, requesting 15 CM 596 and 16 CM 451 be set for plea/sentencing, matter to be set for plea/sentencing hearing tomorrow w/Br. 3, writ has not been cancelled, 9:06 A.M.
Hearing on February 8, 2017 at 09:00 am.
